job_title: Public Safety Officer in Alfred, NY
pros: Shifts and people were fun to work with

review_title: Unless you need free tuition, run away as fast as you can
job_title: Glass shop technician in Alfred, NY
pros: Tuition exchange is about the only thing i can think of.
cons: Too many to list but ill touch a few. Some of the lowest pay out there when compared to the state and national averages. In 8 years not one raise even covered the rate of inflation IF you got any raise at all (somehow the administration has some of the highest pay when compared state wide). The last raises were given from a donation from trustees (red flag that can't get any bigger) Extremely polarized political environment, to the point they let if effect hiring practices. Speaking of which the turnover rate university wide is astounding, and for very good reason. Communication is almost nonexistant, and when it does happen it is waste of time as employees are widely ignored. They seem to find ways to make your job more difficult than it needs to be in ways you did not think was possible.

job_title: Admissions Financial Aid Specialist in Alfred, NY
pros: -Decent benefits (above matching 401k, above matching employer paid health insurance, flexible scheduling, tuition remission/exchange) -Friendly place to work, next to no issues in my time here (6 years) -Room for growth (depending on what you're interested in)
cons: -Pay is lower than surrounding peers. -Lacking compensation increase such as what other institutions have. -Some revolving door situations happening right now... hopeful this will change within the next year or so.

job_title: Grad Research Assistant in Alfred, NY
pros: Hands-On Experience, Small Class Sizes, Unlimited Access to Laboratory Equipment, Freedom to Conduct Research, Excellent Libraries and Resources, Lots of new construction which is allowing for growth, Recently received grant which will allow for the building of a start-up incubator
cons: Low Pay, Not enough technicians/post-docs to maintain equipment, Slow pace of progress, Very small town that is far from everything, Only 2 bars in town, Some professors have very little accountability, Parking is a total nightmare, Very little communication between departments, Low pay for professors results in high turnover and inability to establish good relationships with both undergraduate and graduate student,

review_title: A great place to work and raise a family.
job_title: Director of Holmes Auditorium in Alfred, NY
pros:
Alfred University is a small liberal arts college located in rural Western NY.  The faculty and staff become very close to the 2200 students that attend.  Some of the benefits of working here include tuition remission and tuition exchange for employees and their families.  The area is very beautiful most of the year with 4 distinctive seasons.  It is a place where your kids can go out and play without fear of something happening to them.  A  place where everyone knows their neighbors.  It 
also has a great public school system.
cons: Lower wages than most colleges.  A  long Winter season.

review_title: It was okay but not a lot of opportunities for students without work study.
pros: The jobs were on campus and easy to get to from classes and the organization system was efficient most of the time.
cons: If you are a student and do not have work study there are not a lot of job opportunities, and if you get a job you still won't have many hours because the hours will go to the students with work study.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Scientist in Oviedo, FL
pros: Great place for ceramic research, lots of nice instruments to use, very good art school, small campus to commute, nice dining service, $4 a meal for buffet
cons: in a remote country area, buried in mountains, far away from shopping centers, only one traffic light in town; not many outstanding professors there

pros: The small facility made it very easy to keep track of patrons and everything was easily accessible. It was also nice to have only locals and mostly lap swimmers show up.
cons: Very outdated equipment made the one rescue I had to make incredibly stressful and not go as smoothly as it could have. Maybe move the AED closer to the pool.

pros: Not bad benefit. Free parking for faculty and staff.
cons:
There is poor service in the school. Everything becomes slow. If you like slow pace, it is a good option. Many faculties moved to other schools. It is remote from town. You have to drive  to grocery, especially in winter and summer break because there is not school bus for Walmart. Books in library are very old.

.

pros: Small campus, where everyone knows everyone. Great community.

cons: Nepotism is prevalent at this small upstate New York college. It is difficult to effectively manage student workers with the power afforded to you as supervisor.

review_title: Does not pay a fare wage.
